info.name: @nebula.js/stardust
info.description: Product and framework agnostic integration API for Qlik's Associative Engine

embed.description: Initiates a new `Embed` instance using the specified enigma `app`.

createConfiguration.description:
Creates a new `embed` scope bound to the specified `configuration`.

The configuration is merged with all previous scopes.

returns.description: The value and a function to update it.

useEffect.description: Triggers a callback function when a dependent value changes.

params.name: deps
params.description: The dependencies that should trigger the callback.

useMemo.description: Creates a stateful value when a dependent changes.

returns.description: The value returned from the factory function.

usePromise.description: Runs a callback function when a dependent changes.

params.name: factory
params.description: The factory function that calls the promise.

useElement.description: Gets the HTMLElement this visualization is rendered into.

useRect.description: Gets the size of the HTMLElement the visualization is rendered into.

useLayout.description: Gets the layout of the generic object associated with this visualization.

useStaleLayout.description:
Gets the layout of the generic object associated with this visualization.

Unlike the regular layout, a _stale_ layout is not changed when a generic object enters
the modal state. This is mostly notable in that `qSelectionInfo.qInSelections` in the layout is
always `false`.
The returned value from `useStaleLayout()` and `useLayout()` are identical when the object
is not in a modal state.

useAppLayout.description: Gets the layout of the app associated with this visualization.

useModel.description: Gets the generic object API of the generic object connected to this visualization.

usePlugins.description: Gets the array of plugins provided when rendering the visualization.

useConstraints.description:
Gets the desired constraints that should be applied when rendering the visualization.

The constraints are set on the embed configuration before the visualization is rendered
and should respected by you when implementing the visualization.

useOptions.description:
Gets the options object provided when rendering the visualization.

This is an empty object by default but enables customization of the visualization through this object.
Options are different from setting properties on the generic object in that options
are only temporary settings applied to the visualization when rendered.

You have the responsibility to provide documentation of the options you support, if any.

onTakeSnapshot.description: Registers a callback that is called when a snapshot is taken.

useRenderState.description:
Gets render state instance.

Used to update properties and get a new layout without triggering onInitialRender.

useKeyboard.description:
Gets the desired keyboard settings and status to applied when rendering the visualization.
A visualization should in general only have tab stops if either `keyboard.enabled` is false or if active is true.
This means that either Nebula isn't configured to handle keyboard input or the chart is currently focused.
Enabling or disabling keyboardNavigation are set on the embed configuration and
should be respected by the visualization.

render.description: Renders a visualization into an HTMLElement.

returns.description: A controller to the rendered visualization.

context.description:
Updates the current context of this embed instance.
Use this when you want to change some part of the current context, like theme.
examples:
// change theme
n.context({ theme: 'dark'});

// limit constraints
n.context({ constraints: { active: true } });

selections.description: Gets the app selections of this instance.
examples:
const selections = await n.selections();
selections.mount(element);

field.description: Gets the listbox instance of the specified field

params.name: fieldIdentifier
params.description: Fieldname as a string or a Library dimension

examples:
const fieldInstance = await n.field("MyField");
fieldInstance.mount(element, { title: "Hello Field"});

getRegisteredTypes.description: Gets a list of registered visualization types and versions

ReceiverFunction.description: A callback function which receives another function as input.

mount.description: Mounts the field as a listbox into the provided HTMLElement.

checkboxes.description: Show values as checkboxes instead of as fields

stateName.description: Sets the state to make selections in

properties.description: Properties object to extend default properties with

selectionsApi.description: Use a custom selectionsApi to customize how values are selected.

update.description: A function which receives an update function which upon call will trigger a data fetch.

examples: fieldInstance.mount(element);

unmount.description: Unmounts the field listbox from the DOM.
examples: listbox.unmount();

load.description: A function that should return a Promise that resolves to a raw JSON theme.

Viz.description: A controller to further modify a visualization after it has been rendered.

id.description: The id of this visualization's generic object.

destroy.description: Destroys the visualization and removes it from the the DOM.

convertTo.description: Converts the visualization to a different registered type

params.name: newType
params.description: Which registered type to convert to.

params.name: forceUpdate
params.description: Whether to run setProperties or not, defaults to true.

returns.description: Promise object that resolves to the full property tree of the converted visualization.

isEnabled.description: Checks whether the specified flag is enabled.

returns.description: True if the specified flag is enabled, false otherwise.

mount.description: Mounts the app selection UI into the provided HTMLElement.
examples: selections.mount(element);

unmount.description: Unmounts the app selection UI from the DOM.
examples: selections.unmount();

CreateConfig.description: Rendering configuration for creating and rendering a new object

BaseConfig.description: Basic rendering configuration for rendering an object

GetConfig.description: Rendering configuration for rendering an existing object

Plugin.description: An object literal containing meta information about the plugin and a function containing the plugin implementation.

info.description: Object that can hold various meta info about the plugin

fn.description: The implementation of the plugin. Input and return value is up to the plugin implementation to decide based on its purpose.

qCharPos.description: The (absolute) index where the highlighted range starts.

qCharCount.description: The length of the sub-string (starting from qChartPos) that should be highlighted.

segment.description: The sub-string/segment cut out from the original label.

highlighted.description: A flag which tells whether the segment should be highlighted or not.

params.name: label
params.description: The label we want to create segments out of.

params.name: range
params.description: The indexes which define how to create the segments.

params.name: startIndex
params.description:
An optional index which tells where we want to start the first segment from
  (only relevant for creating the first unhighlighted segment of a string/sub-string).

getMinMax.description:
Returns the min and max indices of elemNumbersOrdered which contains
all numbers in elementNbrs.

Visualization.description: The entry point for defining a visualization.

passive.description: Whether or not passive constraints are on. Should block any passive interaction by users, ie: tooltips

active.description: Whether or not active constraints are on. Should block any active interaction by users, ie: scroll, click

select.description: Whether or not active select are on. Should block any selection action. Implied when active is true.

enabled.description: Whether or not Nebula handles keyboard navigation or not.

active.description: Set to true when the chart is activated, ie a user tabs to the chart and presses Enter or Space.

blur.description: Function used by the visualization to tell Nebula to it wants to relinquish focus

focus.description: Function used by the visualization to tell Nebula to it wants focus

focusSelection.description: Function used by the visualization to tell Nebula to focus the selection toolbar

importProperties.description: Imports properties for a chart with a hypercube.

exportFormat.description: The export object which is the output of exportProperties.

initialProperties.description: Initial properties of the target chart.

dataDefinition.description: Data definition of the target chart.

defaultPropertyValues.description: Default values for a number of properties of the target chart.

exportProperties.description: Exports properties for a chart with a hypercube.

add.description: Registers a string in multiple locales

get.description: Translates a string for current locale.

params.name: args
params.description: Values passed down for string interpolation.

getColorPickerColor.description: Resolve a color object using the color picker palette from the provided JSON theme.
examples:
theme.getColorPickerColor({ index: 1 });
theme.getColorPickerColor({ color: 'red' });

getContrastingColorTo.description:
Get the best contrasting color against the specified `color`.
This is typically used to find a suitable text color for a label placed on an arbitrarily colored background.

The returned colors are derived from the theme.

params.name: color
params.description: A color to measure the contrast against

returns.description: - The color that has the best contrast against the specified `color`.

examples: theme.getContrastingColorTo('#400');

getStyle.description:
Get the value of a style attribute in the theme by searching in the theme's JSON structure.
The search starts at the specified base path and continues upwards until the value is found.
If possible it will get the attribute's value using the given path.

params.name: basePath
params.description: Base path in the theme's JSON structure to start the search in (specified as a name path separated by dots).

params.name: path
params.description: Expected path for the attribute (specified as a name path separated by dots).

examples:
theme.getStyle('object', 'title.main', 'fontSize');
theme.getStyle('', '', 'fontSize');

ExportFormat.description:
Used for exporting and importing properties between backend models. An object that exports to
ExportFormat should put dimensions and measures inside one data group. If an object has two hypercubes,
each of the cubes should export dimensions and measures in two separate data groups.
An object that imports from this structure is responsible for putting the existing properties where they should be
in the new model.

hypercube.description: Provides conversion functionality to extensions with hyperCubes.
